      54                 :             : enum class PduStatus {
      55                 :             :    kValid,           // PDU data are valid and up-to-date
      56                 :             :    kTimedOut,        // PDU reception timed out unexpectedly
      57                 :             :    kTempNotValid,    // PDU receives no updates due to bus not active or Clamp15 off
      58                 :             :    kNotReceivedYet,  // PDU was not yet received on this device, signal data are device-local initial data
      59                 :             :    kNotValid,        // PDU data are not valid
      60                 :             : };
      61                 :             : 
      62                 :             : // The RxPdu_xxx instance are provided to the applications by the calls to the
      63                 :             : // respective listener function (see the documentation of the
      64                 :             : // ISignalDataListener class below).
      65                 :             : //
      66                 :             : // The data type for each signal is automatically determined from the number
      67                 :             : // of bits of the signal as defined in the data definition.  Any extra bits
      68                 :             : // will be set to zero.  For a signal with n bits therefore only the bits 2^0
      69                 :             : // .. 2^(n-1) may hold non-zero values.  This also applies for signal values
      70                 :             : // of type vector<std::uint8_t>: The byte at vector index 0 holds the bits 2^0
      71                 :             : // .. 2^7, the byte at index 1 holds the bits 2^8 .. 2^15 etc.
      72                 :             : //
      73                 :             : // In the target code, these instances are provided to the applications for
      74                 :             : // reading only.  For test code, writing is also possible via the dedicated
      75                 :             : // setter methods.  This way, test code can create RxPdu_xxx instances with
      76                 :             : // test data and send it to the application via the listener instance.
      77                 :             :

     591                 :             :    // --   END: private API for internal use only
     592                 :             : };
     593                 :             : 
     594                 :             : // The ISignalDataListener class is only defined as an interface and has to be
     595                 :             : // implemented by the client code.  For each PDU that the application wants
     596                 :             : // to receive the interface holds an receivedPdu_xxx method.
     597                 :             : //
     598                 :             : // A receivedPdu_xxx method will be called...
     599                 :             : //
     600                 :             : //   a) after the SignalDataAccessHandler is started: The framework will
     601                 :             : //      provide all PDU data initially, because afterwards only updates will
     602                 :             : //      be received.  The data that is received in this phase may be partition
     603                 :             : //      local default data for some PDUs, if those PDUs have at this time not
     604                 :             : //      actually been received from the car network.  This would be reflected
     605                 :             : //      by a PduStatus of kNotYetReceived in the respective RxPdu_xxx
     606                 :             : //      instance.
     607                 :             : //
     608                 :             : //   b) when the PduStatus for this PDU has changed.  For example, if the
     609                 :             : //      platform software does not receive the PDU from the car network for
     610                 :             : //      some time, then the PduStatus will change to kTimedOut, and this
     611                 :             : //      change will be communicated to the application via receivedPdu_xxx.
     612                 :             : //
     613                 :             : //   c) when the platform receives the PDU, and one of the signal values that
     614                 :             : //      the application is subscribed to has changed.  In this case, the
     615                 :             : //      platform will provide an update with all changed signals (but possibly
     616                 :             : //      also with unchanged ones) to the application.
     617                 :             : 
     618                 :           1 : class ISignalDataListener {
     619                 :             : public:
     620                 :           0 :    virtual ~ISignalDataListener() = default;
     621                 :             : 
     622                 :             :    virtual void receivedPdu_PSD_04 (RxPdu_PSD_04 const &) = 0;
     623                 :             :    virtual void receivedPdu_PSD_05 (RxPdu_PSD_05 const &) = 0;
     624                 :             :    virtual void receivedPdu_PSD_06 (RxPdu_PSD_06 const &) = 0;
     625                 :             : };
     626                 :             : 
     627                 :             : // For sending PDU data, applications only have to provide updates of their
     628                 :             : // data to the framework.  All further aspects related to the sending of PDUs
     629                 :             : // are handled by the framework: The framework will, for example, take care of
     630                 :             : // ensuring PDUs are sent out cyclically on the car network with the defined
     631                 :             : // cycle time.
     632                 :             : //
     633                 :             : // TxPdu_xxx classes are for providing updates of PDU signal data to the
     634                 :             : // framework.  Each class holds a default constructor and setter methods for
     635                 :             : // the signals.
     636                 :             : //
     637                 :             : // The set of signals in a TxPdu_xxx class is not necessarily the complete set
     638                 :             : // of signals of the PDU: An application may only be responsible for the
     639                 :             : // sending of a subset of the PDU's signals.  In such a case the TxPdu_xxx
     640                 :             : // class that is part of the API for this application will also only contain
     641                 :             : // setters for those signals that this application is responsible for.
     642                 :             : //
     643                 :             : // Having two applications configured as senders for the same signal has
     644                 :             : // undefined behaviour.
     645                 :             : //
     646                 :             : // Before sending out an instance of a TxPdu_xxx class from within one
     647                 :             : // application, all signal values of that PDU that the application is
     648                 :             : // responsible for must have been set.  In other words, after creation of a
     649                 :             : // TxPdu_xxx instance and before sending this instance, all setter methods
     650                 :             : // must have been called.  There is no defined default value for a signal
     651                 :             : // within a TxPdu_xxx instance.
     652                 :             : //
     653                 :             : // TBD: For PDUs with multiplexed signals some special rules may have to be
     654                 :             : // added here.  Please contact the responsibles for this API when you have to
     655                 :             : // deal with multiplexed signals for sending.
     656                 :             : //
     657                 :             : // The attempt to send out an TxPdu_xxx instance where not all signal values
     658                 :             : // that this application is responsible for have been set has undefined
     659                 :             : // behaviour.
     660                 :             : //
     661                 :             : // The argument provided to a setter method for a signal shall not use more
     662                 :             : // bits than defined in the respective data definition for that signal.  Any
     663                 :             : // extra bits must be set to zero.  For a signal with n bits therefore only
     664                 :             : // the bits 2^0 .. 2^(n-1) may hold non-zero values.  This also applies for
     665                 :             : // signal values of type vector<std::uint8_t>: The byte at vector index 0
     666                 :             : // holds the bits 2^0 .. 2^7, the byte at index 1 holds the bits 2^8 .. 2^15
     667                 :             : // etc.
     668                 :             : //
     669                 :             : // Calling a setter method with an argument that uses more bits than allowed
     670                 :             : // has undefined behaviour.
     671                 :             : 
     672                 :             : 
     673                 :             : enum class ConnectionState {
     674                 :             :    kConnecting,
     675                 :             :    kConnected,
     676                 :             :    kDisconnecting,
     677                 :             :    kDisconnected
     678                 :             : };
     679                 :             : 
     680                 :             : using ConnectionStateNotificationCallback = std::function<void (ConnectionState) noexcept>; // shall not block
     681                 :             : 
     682                 :             : class ISignalDataAccessHandler {
     683                 :             : public:
     684                 :             :    virtual ~ISignalDataAccessHandler() = default;
     685                 :             : 
     686                 :             :    /**
     687                 :             :     * Start the underlying communication with the partition's signal
     688                 :             :     * communication framework.  It is not allowed for applications to call
     689                 :             :     * this method more than once.
     690                 :             :     *
     691                 :             :     * Implementation note: This shall intentionally not be done by or from
     692                 :             :     * within the constructor, but in the separate start method: As this most
     693                 :             :     * likely includes concurrent activities we want to be sure it is done
     694                 :             :     * after the ISignalDataAccessHandler object is fully constructed.  This
     695                 :             :     * shall avoid potential race conditions where a partly constructed object
     696                 :             :     * is accessed.
     697                 :             :     * 
     698                 :             :     * The referenced listener object is expected to be valid allover the 
     699                 :             :     * runtime (infinite lifetime). Neighter shall it be destroyed while system 
     700                 :             :     * is suspending nor shall it refer to any resource that is not available 
     701                 :             :     * anymore when system suspend is initiated.
     702                 :             :     */
     703                 :             :    virtual void start(std::shared_ptr<ISignalDataListener>, ConnectionStateNotificationCallback) = 0;
     704                 :             : 
     705                 :             :    [[deprecated]] void start(std::shared_ptr<ISignalDataListener> p) {
     706                 :             :       ConnectionStateNotificationCallback cb = [](ConnectionState) noexcept ->void {};
     707                 :             :       this->start(p, cb);
     708                 :             :    }
     709                 :             : 
     710                 :             :    /**
     711                 :             :     * Suspend the communication as part of a preparation for shutdown or
     712                 :             :     * suspend to RAM.
     713                 :             :     */
     714                 :             :    virtual void suspend() = 0;
     715                 :             : 
     716                 :             :    /**
     717                 :             :     * Resume the communication after suspend.
     718                 :             :     */
     719                 :             :    virtual void resume() = 0;
     720                 :             : 
     721                 :             : };
     722                 :             : 
     723                 :             : /**
     724                 :             :  * The following function will return the singleton instance of
     725                 :             :  * vwg::sid::PSDParser::ISignalDataAccessHandler.
     726                 :             :  */
     727                 :             : ISignalDataAccessHandler & getSignalDataAccessHandler();
     728                 :             : 
     729                 :             : [[deprecated]]
     730                 :             : inline std::unique_ptr<ISignalDataAccessHandler> createSignalDataAccessHandler() {
     731                 :             :    return std::unique_ptr<ISignalDataAccessHandler>(&getSignalDataAccessHandler());
     732                 :             : }
     733                 :             : 
     734                 :             : } /* namespace PSDParser */
     735                 :             : } /* namespace sid */
     736                 :             : } /* namespace vwg */

     738                 :             : #endif // VWG_SID_PSDPARSER_SIGNAL_DATA_ACCESS_HPP_
